clinical_study.brief_title: Impact of Perioperative Shedding of the Endothelial Glycocalyx on Short-term Postoperative Complication in Patients Undergoing Robot-assisted Esophagectomy
clinical_study.official_title: Impact of Perioperative Shedding of the Endothelial Glycocalyx on Short-term Postoperative Complication in Patients Undergoing Robot-assisted Esophagectomy

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study was to determine whether changes in serum levels of syndecan-1 before and after surgery, which is an index related to injury of the endothelial glycocalyx layer, are associated with postoperative short-term complications and mortality in patients undergoing robotic esophagectomy.

primary_outcome.description: preoperative baseline serum levels of syndecan-1

primary_outcome.measure: blood concentration of syndecan-1 at the end of the surgery
primary_outcome.time_frame: within 5 minutes after the end of surgery (when thd surgical drape is removed)
primary_outcome.description: blood concentration of syndecan-1 at the end of the surgery

primary_outcome.measure: blood concentration of syndecan-1 at 24 hours after surgery
primary_outcome.time_frame: 24 hours after the end of surgery
primary_outcome.description: blood concentration of syndecan-1 at 24 hours after surgery

secondary_outcome.description: Indicate if the patient had an unplanned invasive procedure after surgery. Examples includes return to the operating room for a redo surgical procedure, a percutaneous procedure performed at bedside or in the radiology suite, a tracheostomy, and wound opening at bedside. Exclusions: postoperative toilet bronchoscopy, central venous access, arterial line placement, foley catheter placement.

secondary_outcome.measure: Anastomotic leak following esophageal surgery(STS GTSD 2.41 #3350)
secondary_outcome.description: Indicate if the patient had an anastomotic leak following esophageal surgery.
Indicate whether the patient experienced respiratory failure in the postoperative period requiring mechanical ventilation and/or reintubation.

secondary_outcome.measure: initial ventilatory support greater than 48 hours (STS GTSD 2.41 #3520)
secondary_outcome.description: Indicate if the patient experienced pneumonia in the postoperative period. Pneumonia is defined as meeting three of five characteristics: fever (> 100.4 F or 38 C), leukocytosis, CXR with infiltrate, positive culture from sputum, or treatment with antibiotics.

Indicate whether the patient had acute renal failure or worsening renal function resulting in any of the following: New requirement for dialysis post-operatively Increase in serum creatinine level 3.0 x greater than baseline serum creatinine level â‰¥4 mg/dL , with an acute rise of at least 0.5 mg/dl

secondary_outcome.measure: mortality(Status 30 Days after Surgery, STS GTSD 2.41 #3950)
secondary_outcome.description: Indicate whether the patient was alive or dead at 30 days post-surgery (whether in the hospital or not). time frame: 30days post-surgery

secondary_outcome.time_frame: within 48 h after end of surgery
secondary_outcome.description: defined as an absolute increase in serum creatinine level C0.3 mg/dL, a 50% (1.5-fold) increase in serum creatinine level from baseline, or a reduction in urine output (documented oliguria< 0.5 mL/kg/h for 6h)

arm_group.description: Patients 20 years or older who undergo robotic esophagectomy

study_pop.textblock: patients 20 years or older who undergo robotic esophagectomy

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. patients 20 years or older who undergo robotic esophagectomy
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Emergency surgery
2. If the subject includes a person who can not read the written consent (eg, illiterate, foreigner, etc.)
3. Chronic kidney disease (eGFR <30 mL / min / 1.73 m2)
4. Pregnant and lactating women
